oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Leila Shute Tigert letter of dying wishes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Leila Shute Tigert to Elise Croft and Venie Shute Hotchkiss on Grassmere stationery regarding her wishes following her death. She mentions her own inheritance and giving money to the Morton family as she "is very fond of these employees."

Leila Shute (1868-1952) was one of the four daughters of William and Lavinia Shute. She married Dr. Holland McTyeire Tigert (1880-1948) in approximately 1901. The Tigerts lived at Grassmere and Leila oversaw the running of the farm after her father died.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tigert, Leila Shute
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wills; Distribution of decedents' estates
Death; Inheritance & succession
